coffee_black.name: Coffee, brewed, black
coffee_black.insight: Nearly zero calories with powerful antioxidants and 95mg caffeine. America's #1 source of antioxidants.

balanced.insight: Essentially calorie-free with beneficial polyphenols and caffeine. Excellent for daily consumption.

heart_health.insight: Chlorogenic acid and caffeic acid reduce blood pressure and inflammation. 3-5 cups daily linked to 15% lower heart disease risk.
cons: Excess caffeine can raise heart rate temporarily

muscle_building.insight: Caffeine enhances performance and reduces perceived exertion. But zero protein/calories.

energy.insight: 95mg caffeine blocks adenosine receptors, increasing alertness for 3-5 hours. Peak effect at 45 minutes.

weight_management.insight: 2 calories per cup, boosts metabolism, suppresses appetite. Black coffee is a weight loss ally.

brain_focus.insight: Caffeine + antioxidants enhance cognition, memory, and reaction time. May reduce Alzheimer's risk long-term.
cons: Can impair sleep if consumed late

gut_health.insight: Stimulates bowel movements and increases gut motility. Polyphenols support beneficial bacteria.

blood_sugar.insight: Zero carbs, lowers type 2 diabetes risk by 7% per daily cup. Chlorogenic acid slows glucose absorption.
cons: Caffeine can slightly raise glucose acutely in some people

bone_joint.insight: Minimal calcium. High intake (4+ cups) may increase calcium excretion slightly.
cons: Excess intake may reduce calcium absorption

anti_inflammatory.insight: Chlorogenic acid and caffeic acid are potent anti-inflammatory compounds. Reduces C-reactive protein.

caffeine.tip: Peak blood levels in 45-60 minutes; half-life 3-5 hours

avoidWith.reason: May slightly reduce calcium absorption if consumed together

tips.storage: Whole beans in airtight container; grind fresh for max antioxidants
tips.prepTip: Light to medium roast has more chlorogenic acid than dark roast

commonMistakes: Adding sugar/cream (turns zero-calorie into 100+ calorie drink)
Drinking after 2pm (disrupts sleep)
Drinking on empty stomach (can cause jitters/acid reflux)

cautions.anxiety: Can worsen anxiety or trigger panic in sensitive individuals

coffee_black.pregnancyNotes: Limit to 200mg caffeine daily (12oz). Excessive intake linked to miscarriage risk.
drugInteractions: Blood thinners (vitamin K interaction minimal but note)

tea_black.name: Tea, black, brewed
tea_black.insight: Theaflavins and L-theanine provide calm alertness. Half the caffeine of coffee with unique heart benefits.

balanced.insight: Virtually calorie-free with theaflavins (unique to black tea) that support cardiovascular health.

heart_health.insight: Theaflavins lower LDL cholesterol and improve blood vessel function. 3+ cups daily reduces heart attack risk 11%.

muscle_building.insight: Moderate caffeine boost for workouts, but zero protein. Catechins may reduce muscle damage.

energy.insight: 47mg caffeine + L-theanine = calm, focused energy without coffee jitters. Smoother energy curve.
cons: Half the caffeine of coffee (less intense boost)

weight_management.insight: 2 calories, catechins increase fat oxidation by 16%. EGCG remnants from processing still boost metabolism.

brain_focus.insight: L-theanine + caffeine synergy improves focus and cognition better than caffeine alone. Calm alertness.
cons: Lower caffeine than coffee (less intense if you need strong boost)

gut_health.insight: Polyphenols act as prebiotics, feeding beneficial gut bacteria. Tannins have mild antimicrobial effects.
cons: Tannins can reduce iron absorption if consumed with meals

blood_sugar.insight: Zero sugar, theaflavins improve insulin sensitivity. May lower type 2 diabetes risk.

bone_joint.insight: Phytochemicals may support bone density. Fluoride content varies by source (can be pro or con).

anti_inflammatory.insight: Theaflavins and catechins reduce inflammatory markers. Less potent than green tea but still excellent.
cons: Green tea has more catechins overall

caffeine.tip: Absorbed more slowly than coffee—steadier release

pairWith.reason: Gentle on stomach, provides calm energy
Lower caffeine won't disrupt sleep as much as coffee

avoidWith.reason: Tannins reduce non-heme iron absorption—wait 1 hour

tips.storage: Airtight container away from light, moisture, strong odors
tips.cooking: Steep 3-5 minutes in 200-212°F water for optimal flavor
tips.prepTip: Longer steeping = more caffeine and tannins (can be bitter)

commonMistakes: Adding sugar (ruins zero-calorie benefit)
Over-steeping (makes it bitter and astringent)
Drinking with iron-rich meals (reduces iron absorption)

cautions.anemia: Tannins reduce iron absorption—drink between meals

tea_black.pregnancyNotes: Safe in moderation (1-2 cups/day). Contributes to caffeine limit.
drugInteractions: Blood thinners (vitamin K minimal but note)

pediatric.ageAppropriate: Safe for children in small amounts (low caffeine)

green_tea.name: Tea, green, brewed
green_tea.insight: EGCG catechin powerhouse—boosts metabolism, brain function, and longevity. Minimal caffeine.

balanced.insight: Virtually zero calories with exceptional EGCG content. World's healthiest beverage according to many studies.

heart_health.insight: EGCG lowers LDL, raises HDL, improves endothelial function. Daily drinkers have 31% lower heart disease risk.

muscle_building.insight: Zero protein, minimal caffeine. EGCG may reduce muscle damage from exercise slightly.

energy.insight: Only 28mg caffeine but L-theanine provides calm focus. Gentle, sustained energy without crash.
cons: Low caffeine—won't give strong boost like coffee

weight_management.insight: 2 calories, EGCG increases fat oxidation by 17% and boosts metabolic rate. Weight loss superstar.

brain_focus.insight: L-theanine + caffeine improve working memory and attention. EGCG crosses blood-brain barrier for neuroprotection.
cons: Lower caffeine—less intense focus than coffee

gut_health.insight: Catechins act as prebiotics, promoting beneficial bacteria. EGCG has antimicrobial effects against harmful bacteria.
cons: High intake on empty stomach can cause nausea in some

blood_sugar.insight: Zero sugar, EGCG improves insulin sensitivity by 13%. Lowers type 2 diabetes risk significantly.

bone_joint.insight: EGCG may support bone formation and reduce bone loss. Some fluoride content supports dental/bone health.

anti_inflammatory.insight: EGCG is one of nature's most potent anti-inflammatory compounds. Reduces all major inflammatory markers.

EGCG.tip: Add lemon juice (vitamin C) to increase absorption by 6x

caffeine.tip: Lower caffeine than black tea—absorbed gradually

pairWith.reason: Vitamin C increases EGCG absorption dramatically
Metabolism boost + calm energy to start day

avoidWith.reason: Catechins reduce iron absorption—drink between meals
Casein protein binds catechins, reducing benefits

tips.storage: Refrigerate or freeze green tea for maximum catechin preservation
tips.cooking: Steep in 160-180°F water (not boiling!) for 2-3 minutes
tips.prepTip: Add lemon for 6x more EGCG absorption; don't add milk

commonMistakes: Using boiling water (destroys catechins, makes it bitter)
Adding milk (blocks catechin absorption)
Steeping too long (bitter and astringent)

cautions.liver: Very high intake (8+ cups) on empty stomach may stress liver in rare cases
cautions.anemia: Drink between meals to avoid iron absorption interference

green_tea.pregnancyNotes: Safe in moderation (1-2 cups/day). Low caffeine but still counts toward 200mg limit.

orange_juice.name: Orange juice, raw
orange_juice.insight: Vitamin C powerhouse but 21g sugar per cup. Whole oranges are better—fiber slows sugar absorption.

balanced.insight: Excellent vitamin C and folate, but 21g natural sugar with minimal fiber. Drinking whole fruit is better.

heart_health.insight: Hesperidin flavonoid lowers blood pressure. High potassium supports heart, but sugar content is a concern.
cons: High sugar can raise triglycerides if overconsumed

muscle_building.insight: Only 1.7g protein. Quick carbs for post-workout glycogen replenishment, but better options exist.

energy.insight: 25g simple carbs provide quick energy but no sustained fuel. Blood sugar spike and crash likely.

weight_management.insight: 112 calories and 21g sugar in liquid form—doesn't trigger satiety like whole fruit. Easy to overconsume.

brain_focus.insight: Flavonoids and vitamin C support brain health, but sugar spike can impair focus after initial boost.
pros: Hesperidin improves blood flow to brain
cons: Sugar spike then crash impairs sustained focus

gut_health.insight: Minimal fiber (0.5g vs. 3g in whole orange). High sugar without fiber can disrupt gut bacteria balance.

blood_sugar.insight: 21g sugar with minimal fiber causes blood sugar spike. GI=50, GL=13. Whole oranges far better.
cons: Can worsen insulin resistance if consumed frequently

bone_joint.insight: Vitamin C supports collagen synthesis. Minimal calcium. Hesperidin may reduce joint inflammation.
cons: Acidic (may worsen inflammatory conditions in some)

anti_inflammatory.insight: Hesperidin and vitamin C reduce inflammation, but high sugar can be pro-inflammatory if consumed excessively.

pairWith.reason: Slows sugar absorption—add to breakfast with eggs/nuts
Vitamin C enhances non-heme iron absorption

avoidWith.food: empty stomach if prone to reflux

tips.storage: Refrigerate; consume within 7 days of opening
tips.cooking: Freshly squeezed retains more vitamin C than store-bought
tips.prepTip: Eat whole oranges instead—3x more fiber, more filling, slower sugar release

commonMistakes: Drinking large amounts (easy to consume 3 oranges' worth of sugar quickly)
Choosing from concentrate over fresh (lower nutrient density)
Drinking on empty stomach if prone to acid reflux

cautions.kidney_stones: High oxalates—limit if prone to calcium oxalate stones

orange_juice.pregnancyNotes: Excellent folate source (74mcg per cup) for fetal development. Watch sugar intake.
drugInteractions: Certain medications (can increase drug absorption—consult pharmacist)

cola.name: Cola, regular
cola.insight: Empty calories incarnate—39g sugar (10 teaspoons) with zero nutrients. One of the worst beverages for health.

balanced.insight: 140 liquid calories from pure sugar. Zero vitamins, minerals, protein, or fiber. Nutritionally bankrupt.

heart_health.insight: High sugar intake linked to heart disease, high triglycerides, and increased blood pressure. Avoid.
cons: Daily consumption = 29% higher heart disease risk

muscle_building.insight: Zero protein, zero nutrients. Sugar spikes insulin but provides no muscle-building support.
pros: Quick carbs if desperate post-workout (still terrible choice)

energy.insight: Caffeine (34mg) + sugar gives 20-minute boost, then severe crash. Not sustainable energy.

weight_management.insight: 140 empty liquid calories that don't satiate. One daily can = 15 lbs weight gain per year. Obesity driver.

brain_focus.insight: Sugar spike impairs focus after initial 15-minute boost. Minimal caffeine. Net negative for cognition.
pros: Very brief mental boost from sugar/caffeine

gut_health.insight: High sugar feeds harmful bacteria, disrupts microbiome. Phosphoric acid irritates gut lining. Destroys gut health.

blood_sugar.insight: 39g pure sugar causes massive blood sugar spike (GL=25). Worst beverage for blood sugar control.
cons: Doubles diabetes risk with daily consumption

bone_joint.insight: Phosphoric acid leaches calcium from bones. Regular consumption linked to lower bone density and fractures.

anti_inflammatory.insight: High sugar is powerfully pro-inflammatory. Raises inflammatory markers significantly. Avoid entirely.

sugar.tip: Absorbed immediately—spikes blood sugar within minutes

avoidWith.reason: Provides no nutritional value and harms health

tips.prepTip: Replace with sparkling water + lemon, or iced tea

commonMistakes: Thinking 'just one can' is harmless (39g sugar is massive)
Pairing with meals (displaces nutritious beverages)
Giving to children (sets up sugar addiction)

cautions.kidney: Phosphoric acid may increase kidney stone risk

cola.pregnancyNotes: Avoid—high sugar linked to gestational diabetes, excessive weight gain, and poor fetal outcomes.

beer.name: Beer, regular
beer.insight: 153 empty calories per can, 5% alcohol. Moderate consumption (1/day men, 1/2 for women) may have heart benefits; excess is harmful.

balanced.insight: Alcohol calories (7 cal/g) with minimal nutrition. B vitamins present but alcohol depletes them. Net loss.

heart_health.insight: Moderate intake (1/day) may raise HDL and reduce clot risk. Heavy drinking (3+) damages heart. Thin line.

muscle_building.insight: Alcohol inhibits protein synthesis by 30%+ and lowers testosterone. Destroys muscle-building efforts.

energy.insight: Alcohol is a depressant—slows CNS, impairs mitochondria. Any 'buzz' is followed by fatigue and poor sleep.

weight_management.insight: 153 liquid calories that don't satiate. Lowers inhibitions (leads to overeating). 'Beer belly' is real.

brain_focus.insight: Alcohol impairs cognition, memory, reaction time immediately. Chronic use shrinks brain and causes dementia.

gut_health.insight: Alcohol irritates gut lining, increases intestinal permeability (leaky gut), and disrupts microbiome.
cons: Gluten can worsen for sensitive individuals

blood_sugar.insight: Alcohol blocks liver glucose production—can cause hypoglycemia. Also contains carbs that raise sugar. Chaotic.

bone_joint.insight: Alcohol interferes with calcium absorption and bone formation. Heavy use increases fracture risk.
pros: Minimal silicon (may support bone density slightly)

anti_inflammatory.insight: Small amounts may reduce some inflammatory markers, but overall alcohol is pro-inflammatory. Net negative.

alcohol.tip: Absorbed quickly on empty stomach—eat food to slow absorption

pairWith.reason: Slows alcohol absorption and reduces gut irritation

tips.storage: Cool, dark place; refrigerate for best quality
tips.prepTip: If drinking, limit to 1/day max for men, 1/2 for women. Alternate with water.

commonMistakes: Thinking 'just a couple beers' is harmless (3+ = heavy drinking)
Drinking post-workout (blocks muscle recovery)
Driving after even one drink (impairs reaction time)

cautions.pregnancy: ABSOLUTELY AVOID—no safe amount during pregnancy

beer.pregnancyNotes: AVOID ENTIRELY. Alcohol causes fetal alcohol syndrome and developmental issues. No safe amount.

pediatric.ageAppropriate: NEVER—illegal and harmful for developing brains

red_wine.name: Wine, red
red_wine.insight: Resveratrol and polyphenols offer heart benefits, but alcohol is still alcohol. 1 glass max/day for women, 2 for men.

balanced.insight: Resveratrol and polyphenols provide antioxidants, but alcohol negates many benefits. Moderate at best.

heart_health.insight: Resveratrol raises HDL, improves endothelial function. 1 glass/day linked to 30% lower heart disease. More = harmful.

muscle_building.insight: Alcohol blocks protein synthesis and lowers testosterone. Resveratrol doesn't offset these negatives.

energy.insight: Alcohol is a CNS depressant. Initial 'relaxation' is followed by poor sleep quality and next-day fatigue.

weight_management.insight: 125 calories that don't satiate. Alcohol metabolism stops fat burning. Lowers inhibitions → overeating.
cons: Stops fat burning while metabolizing alcohol

brain_focus.insight: Resveratrol may protect brain long-term, but acute alcohol impairs cognition, memory, and reaction time.
pros: May reduce dementia risk with very moderate intake

gut_health.insight: Polyphenols support gut bacteria, but alcohol irritates gut lining and increases permeability.

blood_sugar.insight: Low carbs (3.8g), but alcohol blocks liver glucose output—can cause hypoglycemia, especially for diabetics.

bone_joint.insight: Resveratrol may support bone health in small amounts, but alcohol impairs calcium absorption overall.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Resveratrol and quercetin are anti-inflammatory, but alcohol itself promotes inflammation. Net benefit only if very moderate.

resveratrol.tip: Better absorbed with food (fat enhances absorption)

pairWith.reason: Food slows alcohol absorption; classic pairing with healthy fats

red_wine.portionVisual: 1 glass = 5oz (smaller than typical wine glass pour)

tips.storage: Cool, dark place; recork opened bottles and refrigerate
tips.prepTip: Measure 5oz—standard pours are often 7-9oz. Max 1 glass/day women, 2 for men.

commonMistakes: Pouring 8-10oz and calling it 'one glass' (it's 2 servings)
Thinking 'it's healthy' justifies daily drinking (benefits are marginal)
Drinking post-workout (blocks recovery)

cautions.breast_cancer_risk: Even moderate alcohol increases risk—discuss with doctor

red_wine.pregnancyNotes: AVOID ENTIRELY. Alcohol causes fetal alcohol syndrome. No safe amount during pregnancy.

dark_chocolate.name: Chocolate, dark, 70-85% cacao
dark_chocolate.insight: Flavanol-rich superfood with 64mg magnesium and exceptional antioxidants. Choose 70%+ cacao and limit to 1oz daily.

balanced.insight: High in healthy fats, magnesium, iron, and fiber. Moderate calories and sugar if limited to 1oz. Quality matters.

heart_health.insight: Flavanols lower blood pressure, improve blood flow, and reduce LDL oxidation. 1oz daily linked to 30% lower heart disease risk.

muscle_building.insight: Minimal protein (2g). Magnesium supports muscle function, but not a muscle-building food.

energy.insight: Theobromine (mild stimulant) + 23mg caffeine + magnesium provide sustained, calm energy. Fat slows digestion.

weight_management.insight: 170 calories/oz dense but satiating. Flavanols may boost metabolism slightly. Portion control essential.

brain_focus.insight: Flavanols increase cerebral blood flow, improving cognition and memory. Theobromine and caffeine enhance focus.
cons: Effect is moderate (not as strong as coffee)

gut_health.insight: 3g fiber and polyphenols act as prebiotics, feeding beneficial bacteria. Cocoa is a gut microbiome superstar.
cons: Some people sensitive to theobromine (GI upset)

blood_sugar.insight: Low GI (23), low GL (3). Fiber and fat slow sugar absorption. Flavanols improve insulin sensitivity.

bone_joint.insight: Magnesium (64mg) and flavanols support bone health. Anti-inflammatory for joints.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Exceptionally high in anti-inflammatory flavanols. Reduces C-reactive protein and oxidative stress significantly.
cons: Choose high % cacao (70%+) for max benefits

flavanols.tip: Absorbed better without milk (milk binds flavanols)

iron.tip: Non-heme iron—pair with vitamin C for better absorption

pairWith.reason: Adds protein and healthy fats for balanced snack

dark_chocolate.portionVisual: 1oz = about 3 small squares (size of your thumb)

tips.storage: Cool, dry place (NOT fridge—causes bloom). 60-70°F ideal.
tips.cooking: Choose 70-85% cacao for max flavanols; 90%+ can be too bitter
tips.prepTip: Let melt on tongue slowly to savor and prevent overconsumption

commonMistakes: Eating 3-4oz thinking it's healthy (510-680 calories!)
Choosing milk chocolate (much less flavanols, more sugar)
Eating with milk (blocks flavanol absorption)

cautions.migraines: Theobromine and caffeine can trigger migraines in sensitive individuals
cautions.kidney_stones: High oxalates—limit if prone to calcium oxalate stones

dark_chocolate.pregnancyNotes: Safe in moderation (1oz/day). Limit caffeine intake overall to 200mg/day.

pediatric.chokingRisk: low (can be choking hazard if large pieces)

olive_oil.name: Olive Oil, extra virgin
olive_oil.insight: Liquid gold of the Mediterranean diet—rich in heart-healthy monounsaturated fats and antioxidants. Use for cooking and dressings.

balanced.insight: Pure fat with beneficial monounsaturated fatty acids and vitamin E. Essential but use in moderation.

heart_health.insight: 73% monounsaturated fat (oleic acid) raises HDL and lowers LDL. Core of Mediterranean diet's heart benefits.

muscle_building.insight: Zero protein. Useful only for adding calories during bulking or for cooking protein sources.

energy.insight: High calories but fat provides slow-burning energy. No B-vitamins or quick fuel.

weight_management.insight: 119 calories per tablespoon adds up fast. Healthy but calorie-dense—measure carefully.

brain_focus.insight: Polyphenols and vitamin E protect brain cells. MUFA supports cell membrane integrity.

gut_health.insight: No fiber, but polyphenols may support gut microbiome. Can ease constipation.

blood_sugar.insight: Zero carbs, zero glycemic impact. Adding to meals slows glucose absorption from carbs.

bone_joint.insight: Vitamin K (8.1mcg) provides modest bone support. No calcium or vitamin D.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Oleocanthal compound has ibuprofen-like anti-inflammatory effects. High polyphenol EVOO is medicinal.
cons: Choose extra virgin for max benefits

pairWith.reason: Fat helps absorb fat-soluble vitamins A, D, E, K from veggies

olive_oil.portionVisual: 1 tablespoon = about the size of your thumb tip

tips.storage: Cool, dark place; use within 2 months of opening
tips.cooking: EVOO up to 375°F; use regular olive oil for high heat
tips.prepTip: Look for harvest date, not just expiration—fresher = more polyphenols

commonMistakes: Using too much (measure with a spoon)
Buying refined olive oil thinking it's the same (EVOO has more polyphenols)

cautions.gallbladder: High fat—may trigger symptoms if gallbladder issues
cautions.weight_loss: Measure portions—easy to add 500+ calories unknowingly

olive_oil.pregnancyNotes: Excellent during pregnancy—healthy fats support fetal brain development

pizza_cheese.name: Pizza, cheese, regular crust
pizza_cheese.insight: Comfort food with 551mg sodium per slice and moderate calories. Occasional treat—not a regular meal.

balanced.insight: Has protein, calcium, and iron, but high in sodium, refined carbs, and saturated fat. Ultra-processed.

heart_health.insight: High sodium raises blood pressure. Saturated fat and trans fat negatively impact cholesterol.

muscle_building.insight: 12g protein is decent but comes with excess sodium and refined carbs. Not optimal for muscle building.

energy.insight: Refined carbs provide quick energy spike followed by crash. Not sustained fuel.

weight_management.insight: 272 calories per slice, and who eats just one? 2-3 slices = 544-816 calories. Easy to overconsume.

brain_focus.insight: Refined carbs spike blood sugar, causing mental fog after initial boost. High sodium can impair cognition.
cons: Heavy meal diverts blood to digestion

gut_health.insight: Low fiber (1.9g), refined flour, and high fat slow digestion. Ultra-processed ingredients disrupt microbiome.

blood_sugar.insight: Refined white crust spikes blood sugar (GI=60, GL=20). Fat and protein help slightly but still poor.
pros: Fat and protein slow sugar absorption somewhat

bone_joint.insight: 220mg calcium (22% DV) is excellent, but high sodium can increase calcium excretion.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Refined carbs, saturated fat, and trans fat are pro-inflammatory. Lycopene helps slightly but not enough.

lycopene.tip: Cooked tomato sauce with fat enhances lycopene absorption

pairWith.reason: Adds fiber, vitamins, and balances the meal

tips.storage: Refrigerate within 2 hours; reheat in oven for best texture
tips.prepTip: Choose thin crust and load with vegetables to improve nutrition. Limit to 2 slices.

commonMistakes: Eating 3-4 slices in one sitting (816-1088 calories!)
Choosing thick crust or stuffed crust (doubles calories)
Skipping vegetables (no fiber, vitamins)

cautions.hypertension: 551mg sodium per slice—avoid or limit strictly
cautions.gluten_sensitivity: Contains wheat—choose gluten-free crust if needed

pizza_cheese.pregnancyNotes: Safe if fully cooked and pasteurized cheese. Watch sodium and portion size.

pediatric.chokingRisk: moderate (stringy cheese can be hazard for young children)

french_fries.name: French fries, fast food
french_fries.insight: Deep-fried starch bombs—365 calories, high glycemic load, and inflammatory oils. Occasional indulgence only.

balanced.insight: High calories, refined carbs, and inflammatory oils with minimal nutritional value. Potassium is only redeeming quality.

heart_health.insight: Deep-fried in inflammatory oils. High GL spikes triglycerides. Trans fats damage arteries. Terrible for heart.
pros: Potassium (but not enough to offset negatives)

muscle_building.insight: Minimal protein (4g). Just empty carbs and fat. Post-workout carb option in desperate times but terrible choice.

energy.insight: High GI (75) causes blood sugar spike then crash. Heavy fat content slows digestion, causing fatigue.
pros: Immediate energy from high GI carbs

weight_management.insight: 365 calories of refined carbs and oil with minimal satiety. Contributes directly to weight gain and belly fat.

brain_focus.insight: Blood sugar spike impairs focus after 30 minutes. Trans fats linked to cognitive decline.

gut_health.insight: High fat slows digestion. Inflammatory oils and acrylamides (from high-heat frying) disrupt gut microbiome.

blood_sugar.insight: Massive glycemic load (36)—one of the worst foods for blood sugar. Causes severe spike then crash.

bone_joint.insight: Minimal calcium. Inflammatory oils worsen joint pain. Trans fats contribute to inflammation.

anti_inflammatory.insight: Highly inflammatory—omega-6 oils, trans fats, acrylamides, AGEs. One of the worst foods for inflammation.

potassium.tip: Well absorbed but negatives outweigh this benefit

avoidWith.reason: Save for rare occasions (monthly at most)

tips.cooking: If making at home: bake in oven with minimal oil instead of deep frying
tips.prepTip: Better option: roasted sweet potato wedges with olive oil

commonMistakes: Ordering large (doubles calories to 730)
Eating regularly (weekly or more)
Pairing with burger and soda (1500+ calorie meal)
french_fries.pregnancyNotes: Safe occasionally but offers no nutritional value. Choose nutrient-dense foods instead.

pediatric.ageAppropriate: Avoid for young children; occasional treat for older kids
